00006 // MS-DOS Real Mode File Header
00008 
00011 void
00012 SgAsmDOSFileHeader::ctor()
00013 {
00014     ROSE_ASSERT(get_file()!=NULL);
00015     ROSE_ASSERT(get_size()>0);
00016     
00017     set_name(new SgAsmBasicString("DOS File Header"));
00018     set_synthesized(true);
00019     set_purpose(SP_HEADER);
00020 
00021     /* Magic number */
00022     p_magic.clear();
00023     p_magic.push_back('M');
00024     p_magic.push_back('Z');
00025 
00026     /* Executable Format */
00027     ROSE_ASSERT(p_exec_format!=NULL);
00028     p_exec_format->set_family(FAMILY_DOS);
00029     p_exec_format->set_purpose(PURPOSE_EXECUTABLE);
00030     p_exec_format->set_sex(ORDER_LSB);
00031     p_exec_format->set_abi(ABI_MSDOS);
00032     p_exec_format->set_abi_version(0);
00033     p_exec_format->set_word_size(2);
00034     p_exec_format->set_version(0);
00035     p_exec_format->set_is_current_version(true);
00036 
00037     p_isa = ISA_IA32_Family;
00038 }
00039 
00041 bool
00042 SgAsmDOSFileHeader::is_DOS(SgAsmGenericFile *file)
00043 {
00044     /* Turn off byte reference tracking for the duration of this function. We don't want our testing the file contents to
00045      * affect the list of bytes that we've already referenced or which we might reference later. */
00046     bool was_tracking = file->get_tracking_references();
00047     file->set_tracking_references(false);
00048 
00049     try {
00050         unsigned char magic[2];
00051         file->read_content(0, magic, sizeof magic);
00052         if ('M'!=magic[0] || 'Z'!=magic[1])
00053             throw 1;
00054     } catch (...) {
00055         file->set_tracking_references(was_tracking);
00056         return false;
00057     }
00058     file->set_tracking_references(was_tracking);
00059     return true;
00060 }
00061 
00064 SgAsmDOSFileHeader*
00065 SgAsmDOSFileHeader::parse(bool define_rm_section)
00066 {
00067     SgAsmGenericSection::parse();
00068 
00069     /* Read header from file */
00070     DOSFileHeader_disk disk;
00071     if (sizeof(disk)>get_size())
00072         extend(sizeof(disk)-get_size());
00073     read_content_local(0, &disk, sizeof disk);
00074 
00075     /* Check magic number early. 
00076      * Some old compilers were little-endian ignorant and stored "ZM", but we will ignore this [DQ]. */
00077     if (disk.e_magic[0]!='M' || disk.e_magic[1]!='Z')
00078         throw FormatError("Bad DOS magic number");
00079     
00080     /* Decode file format */
00081     ROSE_ASSERT(ORDER_LSB==p_exec_format->get_sex());
00082     p_e_last_page_size    = le_to_host(disk.e_last_page_size);
00083     p_e_total_pages       = le_to_host(disk.e_total_pages);
00084     p_e_nrelocs           = le_to_host(disk.e_nrelocs);
00085     p_e_header_paragraphs = le_to_host(disk.e_header_paragraphs);
00086     p_e_minalloc          = le_to_host(disk.e_minalloc);
00087     p_e_maxalloc          = le_to_host(disk.e_maxalloc);
00088     p_e_ss                = le_to_host(disk.e_ss);
00089     p_e_sp                = le_to_host(disk.e_sp);
00090     p_e_cksum             = le_to_host(disk.e_cksum);
00091     p_e_ip                = le_to_host(disk.e_ip);
00092     p_e_cs                = le_to_host(disk.e_cs);
00093     p_e_relocs_offset     = le_to_host(disk.e_relocs_offset);
00094     p_e_overlay           = le_to_host(disk.e_overlay);
00095     p_e_res1              = le_to_host(disk.e_res1);
00096 
00097     /* Magic number */
00098     p_magic.clear();
00099     p_magic.push_back(disk.e_magic[0]);
00100     p_magic.push_back(disk.e_magic[1]);
00101 
00102     /* The DOS File Header is followed by optional relocation entries */
00103     if (p_e_nrelocs>0) {
00104         SgAsmGenericSection *relocs = new SgAsmGenericSection(get_file(), this);
00105         relocs->set_offset(p_e_relocs_offset);
00106         relocs->set_size(p_e_nrelocs * sizeof(DOSRelocEntry_disk));
00107         relocs->parse();
00108         relocs->set_name(new SgAsmBasicString("DOS relocation table"));
00109         relocs->set_synthesized(true);
00110         relocs->set_purpose(SP_HEADER);
00111         set_relocs(relocs);
00112     }
00113     
00114     /* DOS real-mode text/data/etc. */
00115     if (define_rm_section)
00116         parse_rm_section();
00117 
00118     /* Entry point */
00119     p_base_va = 0;
00120     add_entry_rva(le_to_host(disk.e_ip));
00121 
00122     return this;
00123 }
00124 
00128 void
00129 SgAsmDOSFileHeader::update_from_rm_section()
00130 {
00131     /* Find the DOS Extended Header */
00132     SgAsmDOSFileHeader *dos1 = this;
00133     SgAsmDOSExtendedHeader *dos2 = NULL;
00134     const SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList &sections = dos1->get_sections()->get_sections();
00135     for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::const_iterator si=sections.begin(); !dos2 && si!=sections.end(); si++)
00136         dos2 = isSgAsmDOSExtendedHeader(*si);
00137 
00138     /* Update DOS File Header with info about the real-mode text+data section. */
00139     size_t header_size = dos1->get_size() + (dos2 ? dos2->get_size() : 0);
00140     size_t total_size =  header_size + (p_rm_section ? p_rm_section->get_size() : 0);
00141     p_e_header_paragraphs = (header_size + 15) / 16;            /* rounded up to next paragraph */
00142     p_e_total_pages = (total_size + 511) / 512;                 /* rounded up to next page */
00143     p_e_last_page_size = total_size % 512;
00144 }
00145 
00146 /* Encode the DOS file header into disk format */
00147 void *
00148 SgAsmDOSFileHeader::encode(DOSFileHeader_disk *disk) const
00149 {
00150     for (size_t i=0; i<NELMTS(disk->e_magic); i++)
00151         disk->e_magic[i] = get_magic()[i];
00152     host_to_le(p_e_last_page_size,     &(disk->e_last_page_size));
00153     host_to_le(p_e_total_pages,        &(disk->e_total_pages));
00154     host_to_le(p_e_nrelocs,            &(disk->e_nrelocs));
00155     host_to_le(p_e_header_paragraphs,  &(disk->e_header_paragraphs));
00156     host_to_le(p_e_minalloc,           &(disk->e_minalloc));
00157     host_to_le(p_e_maxalloc,           &(disk->e_maxalloc));
00158     host_to_le(p_e_ss,                 &(disk->e_ss));
00159     host_to_le(p_e_sp,                 &(disk->e_sp));
00160     host_to_le(p_e_cksum,              &(disk->e_cksum));
00161     host_to_le(p_e_ip,                 &(disk->e_ip));
00162     host_to_le(p_e_cs,                 &(disk->e_cs));
00163     host_to_le(p_e_relocs_offset,      &(disk->e_relocs_offset));
00164     host_to_le(p_e_overlay,            &(disk->e_overlay));
00165     host_to_le(p_e_res1,               &(disk->e_res1));
00166     return disk;
00167 }
00168 
00171 bool
00172 SgAsmDOSFileHeader::reallocate()
00173 {
00174     bool reallocated = SgAsmGenericHeader::reallocate();
00175 
00176     rose_addr_t need = sizeof(DOSFileHeader_disk);
00177     if (need < get_size()) {
00178         if (is_mapped()) {
00179             ROSE_ASSERT(get_mapped_size()==get_size());
00180             set_mapped_size(need);
00181         }
00182         set_size(need);
00183         reallocated = true;
00184     } else if (need > get_size()) {
00185         get_file()->shift_extend(this, 0, need-get_size(), SgAsmGenericFile::ADDRSP_ALL, SgAsmGenericFile::ELASTIC_HOLE);
00186         reallocated = true;
00187     }
00188 
00189     if (p_relocs)
00190         p_e_relocs_offset = p_relocs->get_offset();
00191     update_from_rm_section();
00192 
00193     return reallocated;
00194 }
00195 
00196 /* Write the DOS file header back to disk */
00197 void
00198 SgAsmDOSFileHeader::unparse(std::ostream &f) const
00199 {
00200     /* Unparse each section reachable from the DOS File Header (e.g., the Extended DOS Header) */
00201     SgAsmDOSExtendedHeader *dos2 = NULL;
00202     for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::iterator i=p_sections->get_sections().begin(); i!=p_sections->get_sections().end(); ++i) {
00203         if (!dos2)
00204             dos2 = isSgAsmDOSExtendedHeader(*i);
00205         (*i)->unparse(f);
00206     }
00207 
00208     /* Some sanity checks:
00209      *  1. DOS File Header must be at the beginning of the file.
00210      *  2. DOS Extended Header, if present, must immediately follow DOS File Header
00211      *  3. DOS Real-Mode Text/Data section must immediately follow headers */
00212     ROSE_ASSERT(0==get_offset());
00213     ROSE_ASSERT(!dos2 || dos2->get_offset()==get_size());
00214 //  ROSE_ASSERT(get_size()+(dos2?dos2->get_size():0) < (size_t)p_e_header_paragraphs*16);
00215 //  ROSE_ASSERT(!p_rm_section || p_rm_section->get_offset()==(size_t)p_e_header_paragraphs*16);
00216 
00217     /* Unparse the header itself */
00218     DOSFileHeader_disk disk;
00219     encode(&disk);
00220     write(f, 0, sizeof(disk), &disk);
00221 }
00222 
00226 SgAsmGenericSection *
00227 SgAsmDOSFileHeader::parse_rm_section(rose_addr_t max_offset)
00228 {
00229     ROSE_ASSERT(NULL == p_rm_section);
00230     
00231     rose_addr_t rm_offset = p_e_header_paragraphs * 16;
00232     rose_addr_t rm_end = p_e_total_pages * 512;
00233     if (p_e_total_pages>0)
00234         rm_end -= 512 - (p_e_last_page_size%512);
00235 
00236     rose_addr_t rm_size = rm_end>rm_offset ? rm_end-rm_offset : 0;
00237     if (rm_size == 0)
00238         return NULL;
00239 
00240     if (max_offset>0) {
00241         if (max_offset < rm_offset) {
00242             rm_size = 0;
00243         } else if (rm_offset + rm_size > max_offset) {
00244             rm_size = max_offset - rm_offset;
00245         }
00246     }
00247 
00248     try {
00249         p_rm_section = new SgAsmGenericSection(get_file(), this);
00250         p_rm_section->set_offset(rm_offset);
00251         p_rm_section->set_size(rm_size);
00252         p_rm_section->parse();
00253     } catch (ShortRead &p_ex) {
00254         /* If the offset or size is out of bounds for the file then assume that the real-mode section does not exist. This
00255          * can indicate that the DOS header is being used for something other than a DOS header. See
00256          * http://www.phreedom.org/solar/code/tinype/ for some examples of overlapping the DOS header with the PE header. */
00257         return NULL;
00258     }
00259     
00260     p_rm_section->set_name(new SgAsmBasicString("DOS real-mode text/data"));
00261     p_rm_section->set_synthesized(true);
00262     p_rm_section->set_purpose(SP_PROGRAM);
00263     p_rm_section->set_mapped_preferred_rva(0);
00264     p_rm_section->set_mapped_actual_va(0); /*will be assigned by Loader*/
00265     p_rm_section->set_mapped_size(rm_size);
00266     p_rm_section->set_mapped_rperm(true);
00267     p_rm_section->set_mapped_wperm(true);
00268     p_rm_section->set_mapped_xperm(true);
00269     return p_rm_section;
00270 }

00272 /* Print some debugging info */
00273 void
00274 SgAsmDOSFileHeader::dump(FILE *f, const char *prefix, ssize_t idx) const
00275 {
00276     char p[4096];
00277     if (idx>=0) {
00278         sprintf(p, "%sDOSFileHeader[%zd].", prefix, idx);
00279     } else {
00280         sprintf(p, "%sDOSFileHeader.", prefix);
00281     }
00282 
00283         const int w = std::max(1, DUMP_FIELD_WIDTH-(int)strlen(p));
00284 
00285     SgAsmGenericHeader::dump(f, p, -1);
00286     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u bytes\n",              p, w, "e_last_page_size",     p_e_last_page_size);
00287     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u 512-byte pages\n",     p, w, "e_total_pages",        p_e_total_pages);
00288     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u relocations\n",        p, w, "e_nrelocs",            p_e_nrelocs);
00289     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u 16-byte paragraphs\n", p, w, "e_header_paragraphs",  p_e_header_paragraphs);
00290     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u 16-byte paragraphs\n", p, w, "e_minalloc",           p_e_minalloc);
00291     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u 16-byte paragraphs\n", p, w, "e_maxalloc",           p_e_maxalloc);
00292     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08u (%u)\n",           p, w, "e_ss",                 p_e_ss, p_e_ss);
00293     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08u (%u)\n",           p, w, "e_sp",                 p_e_sp, p_e_sp);
00294     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u (zero implies not used)\n",p, w, "e_cksum",          p_e_cksum);
00295     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08u (%u)\n",           p, w, "e_ip",                 p_e_ip, p_e_ip);
00296     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08u (%u)\n",           p, w, "e_cs",                 p_e_cs, p_e_cs);
00297     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64")\n", p, w, "e_relocs_offset",  p_e_relocs_offset, p_e_relocs_offset);
00298     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u\n",                    p, w, "e_overlay",            p_e_overlay);
00299     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08u (%u)\n",           p, w, "e_res1",               p_e_res1, p_e_res1);
00300     if (p_relocs) {
00301         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = [%d] \"%s\"\n", p, w, "relocs",
00302                 p_relocs->get_id(), p_relocs->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
00303     } else {
00304         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = none\n",        p, w, "relocs");
00305     }
00306     if (p_rm_section) {
00307         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = [%d] \"%s\"\n", p, w, "rm_section",
00308                 p_rm_section->get_id(), p_rm_section->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
00309     } else {
00310         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = none\n",        p, w, "rm_section");
00311     }
00312 
00313     hexdump(f, 0, std::string(p)+"data at ", p_data);
00314 }
00316 // Extended DOS File Header
00317 // This is normally tacked onto the end of a DOS File Header when the executable is PE, NE, LE, or LX. We treat it as a
00318 // section belonging to the DOS File Header. The PE, NE, LE and LX File Header IR nodes usually also point to this section.
00320 
00323 void
00324 SgAsmDOSExtendedHeader::ctor()
00325 {
00326     set_name(new SgAsmBasicString("DOS Extended Header"));
00327     set_offset(get_header()->get_size());
00328     set_synthesized(true);
00329     set_purpose(SP_HEADER);
00330     set_size(sizeof(DOSExtendedHeader_disk));
00331 }
00332 
00334 SgAsmDOSExtendedHeader*
00335 SgAsmDOSExtendedHeader::parse()
00336 {
00337     SgAsmGenericSection::parse();
00338     
00339     /* Read header from file */
00340     DOSExtendedHeader_disk disk;
00341     read_content_local(0, &disk, sizeof disk);
00342 
00343     /* Decode file format */
00344     ROSE_ASSERT(get_header()!=NULL); /*should be the DOS File Header*/
00345     ROSE_ASSERT(ORDER_LSB==get_header()->get_sex());
00346     p_e_res1              = le_to_host(disk.e_res1);
00347     p_e_oemid             = le_to_host(disk.e_oemid);
00348     p_e_oeminfo           = le_to_host(disk.e_oeminfo);
00349     p_e_res2              = le_to_host(disk.e_res2);
00350     p_e_res3              = le_to_host(disk.e_res3);
00351     p_e_res4              = le_to_host(disk.e_res4);
00352     p_e_res5              = le_to_host(disk.e_res5);
00353     p_e_res6              = le_to_host(disk.e_res6);
00354     p_e_lfanew            = le_to_host(disk.e_lfanew);
00355 
00356     return this;
00357 }

00359 /* Encode the extended header back into disk format */
00360 void *
00361 SgAsmDOSExtendedHeader::encode(DOSExtendedHeader_disk *disk) const
00362 {
00363     host_to_le(p_e_res1,     &(disk->e_res1));
00364     host_to_le(p_e_oemid,    &(disk->e_oemid));
00365     host_to_le(p_e_oeminfo,  &(disk->e_oeminfo));
00366     host_to_le(p_e_res2,     &(disk->e_res2));
00367     host_to_le(p_e_res3,     &(disk->e_res3));
00368     host_to_le(p_e_res4,     &(disk->e_res4));
00369     host_to_le(p_e_res5,     &(disk->e_res5));
00370     host_to_le(p_e_res6,     &(disk->e_res6));
00371     host_to_le(p_e_lfanew,   &(disk->e_lfanew));
00372     return disk;
00373 }

00375 /* Write an extended header back to disk */
00376 void
00377 SgAsmDOSExtendedHeader::unparse(std::ostream &f) const
00378 {
00379     DOSExtendedHeader_disk disk;
00380     encode(&disk);
00381     write(f, 0, sizeof disk, &disk);
00382 }

00384 void
00385 SgAsmDOSExtendedHeader::dump(FILE *f, const char *prefix, ssize_t idx) const
00386 {
00387     char p[4096];
00388     if (idx>=0) {
00389         sprintf(p, "%sDOSExtendedHeader[%zd].", prefix, idx);
00390     } else {
00391         sprintf(p, "%sDOSExtendedHeader.", prefix);
00392     }
00393 
00394     const int w = std::max(1, DUMP_FIELD_WIDTH-(int)strlen(p));
00395 
00396     SgAsmGenericSection::dump(f, p, -1);
00397     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x (%u)\n",            p, w, "e_res1",     p_e_res1, p_e_res1);
00398     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u\n",                     p, w, "e_oemid",    p_e_oemid);
00399     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u\n",                     p, w, "e_oeminfo",  p_e_oeminfo);
00400     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x (%u)\n",            p, w, "e_res2",     p_e_res2, p_e_res2);
00401     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x (%u)\n",            p, w, "e_res3",     p_e_res3, p_e_res3);
00402     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x (%u)\n",            p, w, "e_res4",     p_e_res4, p_e_res4);
00403     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x (%u)\n",            p, w, "e_res5",     p_e_res5, p_e_res5);
00404     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x (%u)\n",            p, w, "e_res6",     p_e_res6, p_e_res6);
00405     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %"PRIu64" byte offset (0x%"PRIx64")\n",  p, w, "e_lfanew",   p_e_lfanew,p_e_lfanew);
00406 
00407     if (variantT() == V_SgAsmDOSExtendedHeader) //unless a base class
00408         hexdump(f, 0, std::string(p)+"data at ", p_data);
00409 }
